Line 19: Line 19:
The name "Google" originated from a misspelling of "[[googol]]," <ref>{{cite web|url=http://graphics.stanford.edu/~dk/google_name_origin.html|first=David|last=Koller|title=Origin of the name "Google"|accessdate=2006-05-28}}</ref> which refers to 10<sup>100</sup>(a 1 followed by one-hundred zeros). Google has become well known for its corporate culture and innovative, clean products, and has a major impact on online culture. The verb "[[Google (verb)|to google]]" has come to mean "to search for information on the internet using the Google search engine".
The name "Google" originated from a misspelling of "[[googol]]," <ref>{{cite web|url=http://graphics.stanford.edu/~dk/google_name_origin.html|first=David|last=Koller|title=Origin of the name "Google"|accessdate=2006-05-28}}</ref> which refers to 10<sup>100</sup>(a 1 followed by one-hundred zeros). Google has become well known for its corporate culture and innovative, clean products, and has a major impact on online culture. The verb "[[Google (verb)|to google]]" has come to mean "to search for information on the internet using the Google search engine".
â
Google's services are run on several [[server farm]]s, each consisting of thousands of low-cost commodity computers running stripped-down versions of [[Linux]]. While the company does not provide detailed information about [[Google platform|its platform]], it was estimated in 2005 that they were using over 100,000 Linux machines.
+
Google's services are run on several [[server farm]]s, each consisting of thousands of low-cost commodity computers running stripped-down versions of [[Linux]]. While the company does not provide detailed information about [[Google platform|its platform]], it was estimated in 2005 that they were using over 100,000 Linux machines.{{fact}}
